name: Triangle Inequality
statement: For any real numbers a and b, |a + b| ≤ |a| + |b|.
philosophy: A geometric property interpreted algebraically to bound expressions.

name: Arithmetic Mean - Geometric Mean (AM ≥ GM)
statement: For any non-negative real numbers a and b, (a + b)/2 ≥ √(ab), with equality iff a = b.
philosophy: Balances between additive and multiplicative tendencies.

name: Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality (2D)
philosophy: Fundamental in bounding dot products and proving norm inequalities.

name: Rearrangement Inequality
statement: For sorted sequences a₁ ≤ a₂ and b₁ ≤ b₂, a₁b₁ + a₂b₂ ≥ a₁b₂ + a₂b₁.
philosophy: Matching like-sized terms maximizes pairwise products.

name: Basic Inequality: x² ≥ 0
statement: For all real numbers x, x² ≥ 0, with equality iff x = 0.
philosophy: The fundamental building block of many inequality arguments.

name: Jensen's Inequality (for convex f)
statement: For convex function f and weights w₁ + w₂ = 1, f(w₁x₁ + w₂x₂) ≤ w₁f(x₁) + w₂f(x₂)
formal: f(w₁x₁ + w₂x₂) ≤ w₁f(x₁) + w₂f(x₂), where f is convex, w₁ + w₂ = 1
philosophy: Convexity allows bounding function values from above or below using averages.
